article: Jack is an English teacher at a college. He moved to New York City  _  all the members of his family. Jack is an excellent teacher, so we've all  _  him very much since he left. It was not long before Jack came back to North Carolina for a short  _  . The teachers and students held a small party for him. At the party, people walked around and  _  with each other. I certainly would not give up that good chance to learn English. So I tried to think of all kinds of topics to talk with Grace, another  _  teacher. Just before I was about to run out of my topics, suddenly I  _  Jack say to others loudly, "I dig New York!" I immediately asked Grace, "Is it really difficult to find a  _  work since he is such a good teacher?" Grace didn't seem to  _  what I said, "Why do you think that?" she asked. "Haven't you heard him say that he is digging New York? Is he building an underground passage ?" I asked. When she finally realized what I meant, Grace laughed to tears. She then asked us whether we  _  the meaning of "I dig New York." All of  _  shook heads and said no. So Grace asked Jack to explain it to us. It turns out that " I dig New York." means "I love New York." in American slang . Though few people say that now, we still hear it from time to time.
